meanings.sent1: After the storm, he had to redrive the nails into the fence.
meanings.sent2: She redrove the route to make sure she didn't miss the turn.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful driver kept redriving the same road over and over.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like redriving a stubborn nail into hardwood.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic's skillful redriving of the car's engine made it run smoothly again.

meanings.definition: To cause to be driven again
meanings.sent1: The instructor had to redrive the point to ensure everyone understood.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain redrived the mud down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved redriving his parents crazy with his antics.
meanings.sent4: His words redrived her determination to achieve her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words redrived hope in the hearts of the audience.

meanings.sent1: The nail was loose and needed redriving into the wall.
meanings.sent2: The car's engine required redriving after the repair.
meanings.sent3: The old memories kept redriving her back to that moment in time.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music redrived his desire to learn the guitar.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the race redrived the crowd's energy.
